<<<explanation>>>: The read method of InputStream reads up to some number of bytes into an array starting at offset. It returns the number of bytes read, or -1 if the end of the stream has been reached.
UPDATE:
The code provided above will read the payload into the byte array, but it does not handle the case where the end of the stream is reached before the payload is fully read. To handle this, you can use a loop to read the payload in chunks until the expected size is reached.
```scala
val in = socket.getInputStream()
val payload = new Array[Byte](size)
var totalRead = 0
while (totalRead < size) {
  val read = in.read(payload, totalRead, size - totalRead)
  if (read == -1) throw new EOFException("Premature end of stream")
  totalRead += read
}
```
This code will throw an EOFException if the end of the stream is reached before the payload is fully read.
